rev.comment: two non-free images are not needed here; one will do just fine, and this one is at least tied to the text

Line 20: Line 20:
A light-weight, [[Comedy-drama|dramedy]] episode, "A Night in Sickbay" sees Captain [[Jonathan Archer]] dealing with the [[List of Star Trek races#Kreetassan|Kreetassans]]âa race of grouchy, officious aliens whom Archer and his crew originally met in the episode "[[Vox Sola]]". This time, the Kreetassans are insulted and negotiations for a badly needed plasma injector break down when Archer's [[dog]], [[Jonathan Archer#Porthos|Porthos]], [[Territory (animal)|urinates]] on one of the aliens' sacred trees. A secondary subplot sees Archer and Dr. [[Phlox (Star Trek)|Phlox]] tending to Porthos after the dog contracts a potentially deadly virus on the planet, and Archer is so consumed with worry that he ends up spending the night in Sick Bay to look after his ailing pet. A tertiary subplot has Archer dealing with unbidden sexual dreams about his first officer, [[T'Pol]]. Through it all, Archer struggles to reach an emotional understanding with Phlox and T'Pol, as the two alien crew members have little grasp of just how important pets are to humans and Phlox keeps offering Archer unwanted advice about dealing with his new feelings for T'Pol. T'Pol also keeps urging Archer to apologize to the Kreetassans for Porthos' behavior, but Archer resists doing this because he blames them for Porthos' life-threatening illness.
A light-weight, [[Comedy-drama|dramedy]] episode, "A Night in Sickbay" sees Captain [[Jonathan Archer]] dealing with the [[List of Star Trek races#Kreetassan|Kreetassans]]âa race of grouchy, officious aliens whom Archer and his crew originally met in the episode "[[Vox Sola]]". This time, the Kreetassans are insulted and negotiations for a badly needed plasma injector break down when Archer's [[dog]], [[Jonathan Archer#Porthos|Porthos]], [[Territory (animal)|urinates]] on one of the aliens' sacred trees. A secondary subplot sees Archer and Dr. [[Phlox (Star Trek)|Phlox]] tending to Porthos after the dog contracts a potentially deadly virus on the planet, and Archer is so consumed with worry that he ends up spending the night in Sick Bay to look after his ailing pet. A tertiary subplot has Archer dealing with unbidden sexual dreams about his first officer, [[T'Pol]]. Through it all, Archer struggles to reach an emotional understanding with Phlox and T'Pol, as the two alien crew members have little grasp of just how important pets are to humans and Phlox keeps offering Archer unwanted advice about dealing with his new feelings for T'Pol. T'Pol also keeps urging Archer to apologize to the Kreetassans for Porthos' behavior, but Archer resists doing this because he blames them for Porthos' life-threatening illness.
â
[[Image:Kreetassan Apology Closeup.jpg|left]]
 
In the end, Porthos recovers from his illness. Swallowing his pride, the captain goes down to the Kreetassan capital city and delivers an intricate ritual apology which involves cutting off slices of a tree trunk with a [[chainsaw]], arranging the pieces of wood in a complex pattern on the ground, and intoning ceremonial phrases in the Kreetassan language. Having mollified the Kretassans, the ''Enterprise'' crew finally manage to procure not one, but three plasma injectors from the high-strung aliens.
In the end, Porthos recovers from his illness. Swallowing his pride, the captain goes down to the Kreetassan capital city and delivers an intricate ritual apology which involves cutting off slices of a tree trunk with a [[chainsaw]], arranging the pieces of wood in a complex pattern on the ground, and intoning ceremonial phrases in the Kreetassan language. Having mollified the Kretassans, the ''Enterprise'' crew finally manage to procure not one, but three plasma injectors from the high-strung aliens.
